> On 11/25/2016 at 12:34 AM, Mikki said:

> Yes, Mr. Manley is around sometimes.
> 

This is funny. Even being very new here I found some areas with in this game where he is mentioned in a career mode contract.

![ManleysFolly.jpg](http://u.cubeupload.com/Saturn5tony/ManleysFolly.jpg)
Me: is scrolling though the ksp forums at 9:30pm in the night on winter so its really dark and sees a intresting mod and clicks on it.

God I can't believe this thread didn't really die yet ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

But making this mod was one of my best memories from playing KSP and interacting with the community, I'm so glad to see that the game is still alive and doing well.
Could someone make this for 1.9.1 please

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Targetedmissle said:
> 
> 
> Could someone make this for 1.9.1 please
> 

Alright, fine. There are a lot of caveats, though.

- First of all, this is distributed under the [Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/) license. Potatto made ~~all~~ both the textures in this mod, and I simply used them in one of the worst ways possible.
- You'll need [KSP 1.9.1](https://www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) and [TextureReplacer 4.1.3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/96851-19x-texturereplacer-413-2322020/).
- The Kerbals in the main menu still have their Kerbal eyes rendered. This is because instead of using the texture in /Skins to overwrite the default texture, I copied the texture into the /Default directory. In flight, the only eyes your Kerbals should have are Scott's.
- In order for your Kerbals to only wear Scott's skin and not anyone else's, you should remove TextureReplacer's default set of varied Kerbal skins in GameData/TextureReplacer/Skins/TR. There's also a TR.cfg in GameData/TextureReplacer that will become useless if you do this, so might was well get rid of it too.
- This update is not efficient and I have done basically no testing on it besides that to make sure it sort of works in a vacuum.
    - Therefore, I offer no support. If you have problems with this, you're on your own. I don't plan to update or debug this in the future because looking at these textures makes me feel uncomfortable and I don't know what I'm doing anyway.

Now that I've tried to insulate myself from the consequences of this action, [Here's my attempt at making this for 1.9.1](https://www.dropbox.com/s/1m2gi61e0cg8crm/ScottManleyHeadPackButSlightlyWorse-1.0.zip?dl=0).

Anyone know if this works in 1.12.1? I know there have been spinoffs, but they seem to include an extra set of eyes. I'd prefer if my Kerbals **only** looked like Scott.

**Edited <time datetime="2021-08-11T02:36:13Z" title="08/11/2021 02:36  AM" data-short="2 yr">August 11, 2021</time> by Dman979**
